detaileddescription.para: This method changes the client channel inactivity timeout
This method returns this proxy's C-string representation.
This method queues some data to be sent to the client, which is opportunistically streamed to the client when bandwidth is available.

simplesect.para: A Python object representing the ID of the data download object.

detaileddescription.para: This gets called when a client dies. Currently, we use it to not send them any more packets. It also informs the client's relatives (the Cell), which grieves for a few microseconds then removes it.
This method is called when this proxy is destroyed.
This method sends a message to the client to restore it to a previous state. This can occur when a cell application dies unexpectedly.
This method writes backup information for this proxy to the input stream.
This function is called when this proxy is offloaded in order to transfer the connected client.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Mercury::Address &dstAddr, bool shouldReset, Mercury::ReplyMessageHandler *pHandler=NULL, const Mercury::Address &externalDestAddr=Mercury::Address::NONE)
memberdef.name: transferClient

detaileddescription.para: This function will transfer the connected client and optionally reset entities on the client if it has been transferred between two different proxies.
This method restores this proxy from the input backup information.
This method is called after the Base entity has finished restoring from the backup stream.
This method does proxy-specific operations in addition to those in Base::restoreTo() when we restore a cell entity from backup.
This method is called when there is confirmation that the witness has been created.
If a client is being transferred between two local proxies, use this special case to avoid having to reconnect.
This method is called when our request to give the client away to another proxy fails.

This method attaches this proxy to the client at the input address. It is only used the first time this client is attached to a proxy on this BaseApp, local handoffs are entirely handled by
giveClientTo.
clientAddr
The client address.
loginReplyID
The reply ID of the login request message.
pChannel
If this is a Mercury/TCP request, the associated TCP channel, otherwise NULL.
Finalise a session with the currently attached client.

parameterdescription.para: If true, the client channel is condemned (and so will continue to send acknowledgements for some time), otherwise, the channel is reset.

detaileddescription.para: Send the client a disconnect message, then disconnect.

parameterdescription.para: True if any client channel should be condemned, false if it should be immediately destroyed. Generally true unless it was a client time-out or other situation where the client channel is probably no longer in a good state.

detaileddescription.para: This method implements the 'get' method for the client attribute.

memberdef.argsstring: (PyObjectPtr, OPTARG(PyObjectPtr, NULL, OPTARG(int,-1, END)))) PyObject *streamStringToClient(PyObjectPtr pData
memberdef.name: ARG

detaileddescription.para: This method deals with our cell entity being destroyed.
This message tells a proxy to accept a connection handed to it from another proxy.
This message is the cell telling us that it has now sent us all the updates for the given tick, and we should forward them on to the client.
This method sends any messages queued by the internal interface (for the external interface). Returns true if the send occurred (or was attempted and failed) and the bundle was flushed.

parameterdescription.para: True if this send is not a regular, periodic send.

detaileddescription.para: This method expands and forwards this avatar position update to the cell.
This method expands and forwards this avatar position update to the cell.
This method expands and forwards this avatar position update to the client.
This method expands and forwards this avatar position update to the client.
This method handles a message from the client acknowledging that it has received a physics correction.
This method handles a message from the client acknowledging that it has received a physics correction.
This method handles a request from the client for information about a given entity. It forwards this message on to the cell.
This method handles a request from the client to enable or disable updates from the cell. It forwards this message on to the cell.
This method handles an acknowledgement by the client of a call to restore its state to a previous state.
This method handles a message from the client telling us that we should disconnect it.
This method forwards a message received on the external interface to the cell.
This method handles a message received on the external interface.
This method handles a message from a ClientViaBaseMailBox. It calls the target method on the client entity.
This method handles a script message that should be forwarded to the client.
This method handles a script message that should be forwarded to the client.
This method gets a suitable stream to the client for an entity property update or method call.

parameterdescription.para: The messageID of the client-side event
The fixed size of the message or -1 if variable.

simplesect.para: A BinaryOStream* to which the message can be written or NULL if no client is attached to this proxy.

detaileddescription.para: Set the login session ID.
Pass ownership of the rate limiter and its associated callback object to this proxy.
When a client logs in, we give a different session key to the login key used to first connect. This one makes a new one, presumably it should only be used soon before the key is sent to the client.
This is a callback called when filter limits are exceeded.
This method prepares the proxy for an impending login.

simplesect.para: The login key generated from adding the pending login.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Mercury::Address &clientAddress, const Mercury::Address &replyAddress, Mercury::ReplyID replyID, const BW::string &encryptionKey)
memberdef.name: prepareForReLogOnAfterGiveClientToSuccess

detaileddescription.para: This method buffers away the details of a re-logon to be completed after an attempt to give the existing client away completes.
This method discards any buffered re-log-on attempt data, replying back to DBApp that the re-log-on attempt should be rejected.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Mercury::Address &clientAddress, const Mercury::Address &replyAddress, Mercury::ReplyID replyID, const BW::string &encryptionKey)
memberdef.name: completeReLogOnAttempt

detaileddescription.para: This method completes a re-log-on attempt.

parameterdescription.para: The client address that is now expected to log on.
The reply ID for the request for onLogOnAttempt.
The encryption key to be used.

detaileddescription.para: Scoped LogMsg for meta data.

briefdescription.para: The bundle to use for client-entity messages.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns the bundle destined for the client channel.
This method sets the client channel to be used by this proxy.

This method adds any opportunistic data to the given bundle, to fill up the corners before it is sent. Right now this means any data which has been queued for download using streamStringToClient() or streamFileToClient().

simplesect.para: The number of extra bytes added onto the bundle.

detaileddescription.para: This method sends an enable or disable witness message to our cell entity.

parameterdescription.para: whether to enable or disable the witness
is this an explicit witness enable/disable send as a result of a restore cell entity?

detaileddescription.para: This method logs a warning about a client trying to control a non-ward.
Pass ownership of the rate limiter and its associated callback object to this proxy.
This method forwards this message to the client.
This method adds the createBasePlayer message to the given bundle

It should immediately follow a successful login or full entity reset, so the client is never operating without a Base Player entity. Note: When this method is called, Proxy::sendExposedForReplayClientPropertiesToCell() should be called together at the same time.

parameterdescription.para: The Mercury::Bundle to add the message to

detaileddescription.para: Change the download streaming rate for this Proxy by the specified amount.
Returns the rate of data streaming to this client scaled by the bandwidth limits of the BaseApp. This is the upper limit for the actual download rate, since we always round down to packet boundaries.
This static function returns a watcher that can be used to watch objects of type Proxy.
This method creates a ProxyPusher for the client's proxy.

The implementation is chosen based on the protocol and configuration options.
pProxy
Proxy instance to create the pusher for.
a ProxyPusher implementation instance.
This class is used to represent a proxy. A proxy is a special type of base. It has an associated client.
